definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: I will join a circus and fly away on a flying trapeze.
sentences.chinese: 我就要变成马戏团里的空中飞人，飞得高高的。

sentences.english: Michael Jorden surnamed “Flying Trapezist” has stepped out of the NBA.
sentences.chinese: “空中飞人”迈克尔乔丹已从NBA中退役了。

sentences.english: Too many jordan shoes online shops to make the correct decision for the air jordans.
sentences.chinese: 太多约旦鞋网上商店作出正确决定的空中飞人。

sentences.english: This is a lot of trapeze is a big temptation.
sentences.chinese: 这一点对于很多空中飞人来说，是个很大的诱惑。

sentences.english: All acrobats wear safety belts when performing flying person.
sentences.chinese: 演空中飞人时都要系保险带。

sentences.english: By the time he was nine years old, he was already performing as a trapeze artist.
sentences.chinese: 他年仅九岁时，便已经在表演空中飞人的特技。

definition: to fly about/to fly hither and thither/to flit/to swarm/to spiral
Spider-Man, see 蜘蛛俠|蜘蛛侠/nickname of French skyscraper climber Alain Robert (1962-)/person who scales the outer walls of a building as a stunt or for building maintenance
lit. to continuously revolve/to work non-stop/to work around the clock (idiom)
a fashion show/to walk the runway (in a fashion show)
